default.description: Unknown Error: Please Contact Programming Research Ltd.

cli_option.name: -crossmoduleanalysisfile
cli_option.description:
Sets up the template to be used for the project-wide .arc and other output files.

Sets up both the prefix and the absolute path (or, alternatively, the path relative to the current directory) of the diagnostic and metric output files generated by RCMA. Such output might take the form of .arc, .cma and .via files.

cli_option.name: -echo
cli_option.description:
Specifies that text is echoed to the console.

This option can be used to show the configuration files that are being referenced.

cli_option.name: -forgetall
cli_option.description:
Resets previous configuration settings for option.

Some options are cumulative in their action in that successive usage of the option adds extra settings rather than replacing the previous ones.

For example:

... -q path1 -q path2 -forgetall q -q path3 filename

For this argument list, the path1 and path2 options will be discarded and only path3 will be quieted.

cli_option.name: -list
cli_option.description: Used to specify a file list containing the source files and their output paths that are to be included in the analysis.

cli_option.name: -nomsg
cli_option.description:
Suppresses the display and generation of the specified messages.

Message numbers can be specified individually, or as a list, range or a combination of both:

  • -nomsg 2356
  • -nomsg 1234,1236,1240
  • -nomsg 2111,2200-2300


This option is only available at the file or directory level. The enabling or disabling of diagnostics at the component level is managed through the Rule Configuration File (RCF).

cli_option.name: -only
cli_option.description:
Only the specified warning messages will be generated.

Message numbers can be specified individually, or as a list, range or a combination of both:

  • -only 2356
  • -only 1234,1236,1240
  • -only 2111,2200-2300


This option is only available at the file or directory level. The enabling or disabling of diagnostics at the component level is managed through the Rule Configuration File (RCF).

cli_option.name: -outputpath
cli_option.description: Determines the path to which all output files will be generated during analysis, and, by extension, the location from which all files will be read as the input for RCMA analysis.

cli_option.name: -prodoption
cli_option.description:
Enables fine-grained configuration of analysis.

prodoption is used to provide additional fine-grained configuration to the analysis performed by a component.

QAX

-prodoption qax::limit=size(KB)

Purpose: Sets the maximum packet size in KB sent to the QAX daemon.

Default:-prodoption qax::limit=30

The following information is sent by the analysis tools to the QAX daemon:

  • Filenames
  • Locations
  • Preprocessor Events
  • Diagnostics
  • Annotations
  • Function Flow Graphs.

This option controls the amount of data stored before being transmitted to the server.

In general this option does not need to be changed, however, if investigating a failure with the tool, it can be useful to set the option to 0 in order that all data is sent immediately to the daemon.

Running RCMA

-prodoption pal2::log={stdout|stderr|filename}

Purpose: The name of the log file to write to.

Default:no entry

When the log option is specified, RCMA will write detailed information relating to libraries and checks used, as well as information on the processed files.

The special filenames stdout and stderr will result in log output being written to STDOUT and STDERR.

-prodoption pal2::threads=number

Purpose: Specifies the maximum number of .arc files to be read concurrently.

Default:no entry

If specified, RCMA will read up to 'number' of files in parallel when populating the database. If not specified, RCMA will use the number of cores on the machine.

-prodoption pal2::keep_ixx[{+|-}]

Purpose: Specifies that the intermediate output from .arc file processing not be removed.

Default:-prodoption pal2::keep_ixx+

Processing the output from the parser, especially for a large project, can be expensive. When an intermediate output is present, the output from the parser is only processed a second time if its content has changed.

If disk space is an issue, then disabling this option will result in the intermediate .ixx files being deleted once they are no longer required.

Encapsulation Thresholds

-prodoption class::member_encapsulation_ratio=ratio

Purpose: Threshold setting for ratio between members and getters/setters.

Default:no entry

When the member_encapsulation_ratio is specified, RCMA will calculate the ratio of members to public getters/setters. If the actual ratio is larger than the specified ratio, then message 1760 will be generated.

Similar Name Analysis

-prodoption close_name::similar='string1'[, 'string2' [, ..., 'stringn']]

Purpose: Characters to be considered as identical when matching identifiers.

Default:no entry

Each specified character in each set is mapped to a unique character value. If a character in a source code identifier appears in the specified set then it is replaced with the unique character value for that set when matching identifiers.

The stringN options should be specified using JSON (JavaScript Object Notation).

For Example, with -prodoption close_name::similar=['O0'] the following identifiers will be considered as similar: 


int FOO;
int F00;

-prodoption close_name::ignore='string1'[, 'string2' [, ..., 'stringn']]

Purpose: Characters to be ignored when matching identifiers.

Default:no entry

After the processing of the -prodoption close_name::similar option (if specified), each argument to the ignore option is removed from source code identifiers.

The stringN options should be specified using JSON (JavaScript Object Notation).

For Example, with -prodoption close_name::ignore=['_'] the following identifiers will be considered as similar: 


int F_O_O;
int FOO;

-prodoption close_name::any_case[{+|-}]

Purpose: Specifies that case is to be ignored when matching identifiers.

Default:-prodoption close_name::any_case-

After the processing of the -prodoption close_name::similar and -prodoption close_name::ignore options (if specified), any upper case characters in source code identifiers are changed to lower case.

For Example, with -prodoption close_name::any_case+ the following identifiers will be considered as similar: 


int FOO;
int foo;

-prodoption close_name::sig_char=limit

Purpose: Maximum length within which two identifiers must be unique, default value is 64.

Default:no entry

If two source code identifiers do not differ within the number characters specified, then a diagnostic will be issued.

For example, with -prodoption close_name::sig_char=6 the following identifiers will trigger a diagnostic: 


int abcdef1;
int abcdef2;

-prodoption close_name::sig_extern_char=limit

Purpose: Maximum length within which two external identifiers must be unique, default value is the same as that of close_name::sig_char.

Default:no entry

If two source code external identifiers do not differ within the number characters specified, then a diagnostic will be issued.

For example, with -prodoption close_name::sig_extern_char=6 the following identifiers will trigger a diagnostic: 


              
extern int abcdef1;
extern int abcdef2;

Initialization Analysis

-prodoption init::functions= 'string1'[, 'string2' [, ..., 'stringn' [; ...']]]

Purpose: List of functions requiring initialization.

Default:-prodoption init::functions=main,wmain,WinMain,wWinMain,DllMain,wDllMain,::main,::wmain,::WinMain,::wWinMain,::DllMain,::wDllMain

Configures RCMA to check that distinct pairs of functions are always called in the specified order.

Function pairs are created by combining the first function with subsequent names. For example, init1,func1,func2 will create the pairs "init1, func1" and "init1, func2".

The order in which these pairs are added is not significant. This analysis takes place for all program entry points (see -po init::entry).

For example, in the following, RCMA will check that "init1" is called before "func1b" and "init2" before "func2": 

-prodoption "init::functions=init1,func1a,func1b;init2,func2"

Fully qualified QA names should be used for C++. A wildcard of the form "@*" can be used to refer to members of unnamed namespaces.

-prodoption init::entry= 'string1'[, 'string2' [, ..., 'stringn']]

Purpose: List of entry points into program.

Default:no entry

Configures RCMA, QAC and QACPP to treat the functions specified in this option as entry points for the program. Although Dataflow and MTA do not read this option directly, QAC and QACPP will set the appropriate functions as entry points and this affects certain analysis Dataflow and MTA does.

cli_option.name: -quiet
cli_option.description:
Suppresses the generation of diagnostic and metrics output for the specified file or files in the specified path.

This will have the effect of suppressing warning messages as well as significantly reducing the size of the output produced.


This option applies only to included files and has no effect on the main source file.


This option should not be used for project header files or directories, as it may affect the results of CMA, Project Metrics and Reports.

cli_option.name: -quietextended
cli_option.description:
Suppresses the generation of diagnostic output for unused contents of the specified file or files in the specified path.

This will have the effect of suppressing warning messages as well as significantly reducing the size of the output produced. This suppression is limited to constructs from those files/folders that are not used in non suppressed files.

When the argument is a non-absolute path, the path is interpreted to be a regular file path relative to a -systeminclude path. If the concatenation of a system include path and the relative file path corresponds to an existing file, the option takes effect on that file.


This option applies only to included files and has no effect on the main source file.

cli_option.name: -remark
cli_option.description: The -remark option can be used to add additional comments into configuration files. Alternatively, comments can be included in the configuration files by prefixing the comments with an asterisk.

cli_option.name: -settings
cli_option.description:
Print the settings used by the tool after the complete processing of all command line arguments.

When enabled, the current values for all configuration options are listed to the standard output.

cli_option.name: -threshold
cli_option.description:
When specified, message msg_no is output whenever the threshold condition (from the set {<|<=|=|>|>=} for specified metric is exceeded.

The metric is specified by the name that appears in the metrics records of the .arc file. There are no default values. If :msg_no is omitted the default analyzer message 4700 will be used.

The optional prefix_ can be used to specify the Compliance Module that msg_no is associated with.

cli_option.name: -url
cli_option.description:
The URL of the server to which analysis data should be sent.

If no -url is specified, then output will be sent to the legacy output formats.

cli_option.name: -version
cli_option.description: When enabled, the version number is printed to standard out and the tool will exit immediately.

cli_option.name: -via
cli_option.description: Used to specify a file containing additional configuration options.

cli_option.name: -virtualmemorylimit
cli_option.description:
Determines the limit on the available memory a component can utilise.

Before analysis is performed by a component a limit is set on the amount of memory that the component can utilise. By default this limit is set to either a percentage of the systems physical memory or a default fixed size, whichever is largest.

This option determines the limit placed on the memory available to the component during analysis as a percentage of the total systems memory.

If the argument of this option is 0 then no memory limit is applied to the component. And if the value of the argument does not lie between 0 and 100 then the default limit will be applied.
